title: 4 things to know about Patriots divisional-round playoff foe Texans
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: New England Patriots Drake Maye and the Patriots’ offense will have their hands full against a dynamic Texans defense that can generate plenty of pressure.
Drake Maye made his first NFL start last season against Houston.

(AP Photo/Charles Krupa) By Conor Ryan January 13, 2026 | 6:25 AM 5 minutes to read The New England Patriots will look to punch their ticket to the AFC title game next Sunday when they play host to the Houston Texans in the AFC divisional round on Sunday afternoon.

title: Patriots to play Houston Texans in AFC divisional round
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: New England Patriots The Patriots will host Houston at Gillette Stadium on Sunday, with kick-off set for 3 p.
m.
Drake Maye will have his hands full with Houston's elite defense.

title: Boston’s homicide rate increases 30% from 2024, from 24 killings to 31
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Local News 2025’s 31 homicides is still the lowest in the last two decades, excluding 2024, Boston Police Commissioner Michael Cox said.
Boston Police Commissioner Michael Cox, Boston Mayor Michelle Wu, and Isaac Yablo, Senior Advisor for Public Safety in 2024.
Suzanne Kreiter/The BostonGlobe ShareSend this article to your social connections.

title: Finally given NHL shot, Bruins’ Jonathan Aspirot has been difference-maker on defense
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Boston Bruins "You talk about paying your dues.
You keep pushing for the dream.
" Jonathan Aspirot has been a key piece on Boston's blue line.

title: 1 killed in Barnstable car crash, police say
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: Local News The crash occurred on Route 6, westbound, at the 6 mile marker.
By Carson Lyle January 12, 2026 Less than a minute to read ShareSend this article to your social connections.
A person died in a car crash in Barnstable the evening of Jan.

title: Anfernee Jennings made the most of his biggest opportunity of the season against the Chargers
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: New England Patriots Jennings tied his season-high for snaps with 39 and delivered a sack on third down late in the fourth quarter.

Anfernee Jennings Danielle Parhizkaran/Globe Staff Shortly before this season began, Anfernee Jennings found himself in a peculiar spot playing deep into preseason games and answering questions about trade rumors.
The veteran linebacker hoped to remain in New England, which had become a second home to him over the past five years after the Patriots drafted him in 2020.

title: Bomb threat sent to Suffolk University prompts library evacuation, sweeps
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: Local News Boston police said "multiple institutions" have received similar threats, Suffolk University police said in an update sent to the university community.
A building at Suffolk University.
Pat Greenhouse/The Boston Globe Staff) An emailed bomb threat to Suffolk University prompted the school to temporarily shut down a campus library Monday morning, a university official said.

title: Celtics reportedly showing trade interest in Mavericks big man
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Boston Celtics The Celtics could use another option up front to complement a big man like Neemias Queta.
Daniel Gafford would give Boston more depth up front this season and beyond.
AP Photo/Tony Gutierrez As Brad Stevens and the rest of the Celtics’ top brass seek avenues to upgrade Boston’s frontcourt before the NBA trade deadline, a new target is reportedly in the mix.

title: What Craig Breslow said about Red Sox losing Alex Bregman sweepstakes to Cubs
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Boston Red Sox "Any time you are active in trying to bring a player in, it’s disappointing to lose out.
" Craig Breslow and the Red Sox need to pivot after losing out on Alex Bregman.
Danielle Parhizkaran/The Boston Globe After just one season in Boston, Alex Bregman is heading to Wrigleyville.
